WizardTD.game.events

Class EventSchedule

  • java.lang.Object
    • WizardTD.game.events.EventSchedule
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EndlessEventSchedule

    public class EventSchedule
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EventSchedule()
      Initalises the event schedule.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void finaliseSchedule()
      Adds final event of functionally infinite duration to event schedule to allow the game to continue more easily even if there are no further events.
      Event getEvent()
      Retrive the current event.

      Finds the time between the end of the previous event and the beginning of the current/next event.

      Exposes the queue of events that represents the event schedule.

      Adds a specified event to occur after all existing events to the event schedule.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventSchedule

        public EventSchedule()
        Initalises the event schedule.

    • Method Detail

      • finaliseSchedule

        public void finaliseSchedule()
        Adds final event of functionally infinite duration to event schedule to allow the game to continue more easily even if there are no further events.

      • updateNumberOfEvents

        public void updateNumberOfEvents(int count)

      • scheduleEvent

        public void scheduleEvent(Event event)
        Adds a specified event to occur after all existing events to the event schedule.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to be added to the schedule.

      • getNumberOfEvents

        public int getNumberOfEvents()
        Returns:
        An integer representing the number of events that will take place throughout the course of the game.

      • getNextEvent

        public Event getNextEvent()
        Returns:
        The next event in the schedule.

      • getEvent

        public Event getEvent()
        Retrive the current event.
        Returns:
        The event taking place or if no event is currently taking place (ie pre-event pause), the event that is about to begin.

      • getNextPauseDuration

        public int getNextPauseDuration()
        Finds the time between the end of the previous event and the beginning of the current/next event.
        Returns:
        the duration of the pause between the last two events.

      • getPauseDuration

        public int getPauseDuration()

      • getEventDuration

        public int getEventDuration()
        Returns:
        The duration of the current event or if there is no current event the event next to begin.

      • getSchedule

        public java.util.Queue<Event> getSchedule()
        Exposes the queue of events that represents the event schedule.
        Returns:
        The queue of events that is the core of the event schedule.
